pageContext.claim: “The biggest percentage increase [in wages is for]-- blue-collar workers.”
pageContext.analysis: It's unclear how Trump defines "blue-collar jobs." Manufacturing jobs have increased by 462,000 since he took office, according to data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics. But this trend is not new. These jobs have been growing steadily since the end of the Great Recession. Similarly, wages for these jobs have been steadily growing, but the increase follows the same trend that started under the Obama administration.
